thread.title: Study: Vt. ranks poorly in fiscal health
thread.title_full: Study: Vt. ranks poorly in fiscal health - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: Adam Sullivan
title: Study: Vt. ranks poorly in fiscal health
text:
MONTPELIER, Vt. - A new study published in Vermont Business Magazine gives the state poor scores when it comes to fiscal health.
The study conducted at George Mason University ranks Vermont 39th in the country. The study looked at numerous factors including, cash on hand, balanced budgets, long-term liabilities, and pensions. According to the study, Vermont scores well on pensions and total debt, but not as well with the other criteria.
The Shumlin administration is downplaying the results.
"This ranking you speak of, I mean there are business climate rankings all over the place. We just also scored 4 in the most entrepreneurial state, and 5 on new business startups, so pick your ranking that you want to look at," said Pat Moulton, Vt. Commerce Secretary.
According to this study, New Hampshire scores better than Vermont coming in at 20th in the country. New York, on the other hand, does worse, ranking 46th.
